info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 8:13PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage AK
info.description:
* Winds: A front will bring easterly to southeasterly winds gusting up to 35-40 mph for the Kuskokwim Delta coast. Winds will be strongest Wednesday morning, then decrease by Wednesday afternoon. Confidence is high that this storm will NOT be as strong as former Typhoon Halong.
* Coastal water levels: Little to no coastal flooding is expected with this storm. Onshore winds could cause water levels to be 1-3 feet above the normal highest tide line in Kwigillingok and Kongiganak during Wednesday morning's high tide. Previously flooded and/or low-lying areas may see a small increase in water levels and could be slow to drain. For other communities, this wind direction rarely causes flooding.
* Preparedness: Secure loose debris that may be blown about by strong winds. Move items that are near the coast further inland or to higher ground. Stay tuned to the forecast. Help share weather information with people whose communication networks may have been affected by the recent storm.

parameter.value: STRONG WINDS AND ELEVATED WATER LEVELS FROM TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Kuskokwim Delta Coast and Nunivak Island
